benchmark_details.name: NbQA
benchmark_details.overview: NbQA is a large-scale dataset of standardized task-solution pairs extracted from Jupyter notebooks, designed to enhance multi-step reasoning capabilities in data analysis workflows.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To improve large language models' capabilities in performing multi-step data analysis tasks through a dataset of standardized task-solution pairs.

data.source: 1.6 million Jupyter notebooks collected from GitHub
data.annotation: Automatically extracted and annotated through a pipeline utilizing GPT-4o.

methodology.calculation: Overall accuracy is calculated based on the number of tasks correctly solved by models on evaluation benchmarks.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better performance in data analysis and reasoning tasks.
methodology.baseline_results: Comparison with Qwen2.5-7B and Qwen2.5-14B Instruct models, showing significant accuracy improvements after fine-tuning on NbQA.
methodology.validation: Validation is performed through rigorous testing on InfiAgent-DABench to ensure the effectiveness of the dataset.
